author: ReaffirmReality
text:
That can get much better. I was in that mindset through most of college, where I had just enough interaction with my parents to keep me hopeless. It is super hard to get up and get going, but once you do it gets easier because you get positive reinforcement.

Of course, I'm totally screwed up right now with the covid situation, but once it's over it's just a matter of putting the work in to get back to being ok. I recommend starting with a group relating to a hobby. Then you just casually go talk about the hobby and eventually become full friends, less pressure than specifically trying to "meet people."

With a bit of luck and more hard work is fair, you can find a place to belong and people who really love you.

author: betoniram_plaze
text: Except it can't get better. I'm at the peak of my life right now and suicide literally is my only way out.

author: ReaffirmReality
text:
I'm sorry you're at such a desperate place, and please know you're not alone in those feelings. If it helps at all, abuse tends to warp your understanding of reality and set up mental barriers where no physical ones exist. I hope you can find some support to help ease the burden and get to a place of wellness, but I know from first hand experience how horribly difficult and unfair to have to slog through that kind of pain.

I don't know your situation, but speaking for myself and many others, things improve considerably when you are able to put physical and emotional distance between yourself and the narcs. If you haven't been able to do that yet, it's a change that's worth holding out for.
